titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4719

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
&#9758 Special attention given to the collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KEENON, Ass't Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed, Clerk.
Frankfort, Ky., March 21, 1864.
Hon. Tho. E. Bramlette
Gov. of Ky.
Dr. Sir

N. N. Johnson Sheriff of Webster County for 1861, this day paid balance on Rev. 1861 for said year, with Interest and costs, and now prays your Excellency, to be relieved from the payment of Six Hundred & Sixty Nine 60/100 Dollars (669.60/100) this being the amount adjudged against him, for the nonpayment of the Revenue, for said County & year, at the time required by Law

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
N. N. Johnson
Shff of Webster Co
$669.60
Damages
21st Mch. 1864
